data.title: Intellisense issue with NODE_PATH evnvironment variable in JavaScript project.
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.13 - OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.5 Steps to Reproduce: 1. NODE_PATH set to project's root. 2. require files based on root directory. This is working in node correctly but intellisense is not working correctly. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/10359 This fix is working for TypeScript but not working for JavaScript In my root folder I have config file but intellisense is taking another d.ts file.

data.title: Visual Studio Code litters FS with unnecessary .vscode/symbols.json
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.0 (376c52b955428d205459bea6619fc161fc8faacf, 2017-06-08T16:34:53.678Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.8.0|
|swift|Kasik96|0.0.3|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.16|
|vscode-color|anseki|0.4.1|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.4.2|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|tstools|iBotMedia|1.1.3|
|raml|jeppeandersen|1.0.1|
|Lua|keyring|0.0.9|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|vscode-less|mrmlnc|0.6.3|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.4|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.10.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|1.3.2|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.12.1|
|annotator|ryu1kn|0.10.1|
|swiftlint|shinnn|0.1.3|
|html-preview-vscode|tht13|0.1.1|;


---

VSCode is, IMHO, one of the best text editors out there. For me it replaced several others and when having to check something or change some config files or what-so-ever my first move is to open containing directory in VSCode.

And that works perfect. Except for VSCode littering my files with it's unnecessary and unused, empty symbols.json files. While it makes sense when used as IDE it really is a show-stopper for using VSCode as simple text-editor to quickly make some small changes somewhere. But for the later it is an awesome tool as well!

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any arbitrary directory in VSCode
2. VSCode creates an empty symbols.json in a .vscode subdirectory
3. Close VSCode when done editing
4. Clean up those unnecessary files you don't want to have because you just wanted to edit some simple text-file

data.title: Request: Support for Beyond Compare as diff tool
data.body: The default diff tool in VSC is nice, but I'd like to use my favourite tool Beyond Compare. Just like in VS17 it should be possible to simply configure what diff/merge tool I'd like to use.

data.title: Show user comments inside extension description page
data.body: Would be great if I could see the User Reviews (those are in a particular extension web page) inside the visual studio code. When I search for an extension, I'd like to read the comments to make sure that extension fits my needs.

data.title: VSCode can't recognize folder when using OneDrive Files On-Demand
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.0 (376c52b955428d205459bea6619fc161fc8faacf, 2017-06-08T16:43:13.058Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16215
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.8.0|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|2.1.7|
|tortoise-svn|fantasytyx|0.1.1|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.1.1|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.10.0|
|angular2-inline|natewallace|0.0.17|
|java|redhat|0.5.0|
|guides|spywhere|0.8.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to https://goo.gl/ZNMyti to install new version OneDrive to enable  OneDrive Files On-Demand .
2. Right-click the white or blue OneDrive cloud icon in the notification area, at the far right of the taskbar. 
(You might need to click the Show hidden icons arrow  next to the notification area to see the OneDrive icon. If the icon doesn't appear in the notification area, OneDrive might not be running. Click Start, type OneDrive in the search box, and then click OneDrive in the search results.)

3. Click the Settings gear.
4. On the Settings tab, select the Save space and download files as you use them box  .
5. After sync is complete. Open VSCode and click "Open Folder" button.
6. Chose folder in OneDrive and click open button.
7. VSCode will show up a message say can't find the path.

data.title: Restart cog does not restart VS Code (Insiders)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (bbcd10ae1a959c1681469533321fa418da7cd9db, 2017-06-13T05:13:35.880Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.5|
|Untabify|ilich8086|0.0.2|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.4|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Restart Cog in bottom left hand corner has circled '1' overlaying it (I assume this means an update is available and a restart required)
2. Click cog
3. VS Code shuts down but does not restart
4. Manually restart VS Code.  Restart Cog in bottom left hand corner still has circled '1' overlaying it.

data.title: window.zoomLevel value is -1 every time vscode is reopened

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When I launch VSCODE the `window.zoomLevel` is lower than normal. If I then click _"View >Rezet zoom"_ it zooms back to normal (`window.zoomLevel: 0`). If I reopen the app the zoomLevel is yet again to low.

(The value is set to `0` in my user settings and it's not defined in my workspace settings).


- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.0 (376c52b955428d205459bea6619fc161fc8faacf, 2017-06-08T16:43:13.058Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Handlebars|andrejunges|0.2.0|
|handlebars-preview|chaliy|1.1.0|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.2|
|mustache|dawhite|1.0.0|
|vscode-babel-coloring|dzannotti|0.0.4|
|gitlens|eamodio|4.1.1|
|vscode-html-css|ecmel|0.1.6|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.3.2|
|webpack|jeremyrajan|2.0.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.10.0|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.9|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.4.1|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.24.8|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|1.1.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click _"View >Rezet zoom"_ to make sure zoomLevel is normal
2. Close all Code app windows if any are open
3. Open Code again. The zoomLevel is now lower than the default `0` value.

data.title: Allow making Help -> About text copyable and display OS version in there
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows Home [Version 10.0.15063]

I suggest you make the info in the About modal copyable so it can be easily pasted into an issue and update the issue template to ask for this info copied verbatim instead of the list with VS Code version and OS version. Intending to replace both, the About modal should also contain OS version.

It can either be made a readonly text field, or better yet a Copy to Clipboard button could be added to save the user a mouse drag.

data.title: Add spaces and fix switch to actual MarkDown
data.body:
I've added spaces after the colons and the numbered list does so the reporter doesn't have to do it themselves or worse yet doesn't default to not adding them.

I've also removed the HTML comment, because it makes no sense in a MarkDown file, especially when it defaults to edit view when creating an issue. I've converted the link to MarkDown link, too.

data.title: When hovering over vertical menu tooltips, icons have shortcuts in them, but wrapper buttons don't
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home 10.0.15063

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Hover over vertical menu icons and slowly slide up and down
2. See the tooltip containing shortcut where directly over icon, not when just over the button space

Should be consistent across both

data.title: Large Chinese text file: minimap hides half character
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.0 (376c52b955428d205459bea6619fc161fc8faacf, 2017-06-08T16:43:13.058Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open 1.md
2. open 2.md
3. open test.md, the minimap hides half character.

- If I close all editors and then only open test.md, things become normal.
- Triple click will make it normal.

- The explorer width may have an impact.
- Also reproduce using default settings.

![hidetext](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11925432/27119800-da2d49f2-5113-11e7-91ad-cb39c900953c.gif)

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0 & 1.14.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

1. Open a long file with scroll bar
2. Shift+Arrow key to select some text, until the scroll bar changes, i.e. scroll.
3. Keep the Shift key, release the Arrow key, and then clicked on a point.

data.title: Code Helper high CPU usage on MacBook Pro 13
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0 (1.13.0) 376c52b955428d205459bea6619fc161fc8faacf 2017-06-08T16:31:58.321Z
- OS Version:  macOS Sierra 10.12.5

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8621814/27115377-c4da279e-50fc-11e7-957d-f07b539a014a.png)

I have disable all extensions
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8621814/27115374-beb61e04-50fc-11e7-94a0-96f267a88fa2.png)

```bash
$ ps aux | grep 57102
wangyong         57102 100.0  1.3  3251200 105020   ??  R    12:06   9:04.40 /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Frameworks/Code Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Code Helper /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/node_modules/typescript/lib/typingsInstaller.js --globalTypingsCacheLocation /Users/wangyong/Library/Caches/typescript --enableTelemetry
wangyong         57858   0.0  0.0  2442020    796 s003  S+   12:15   0:00.00 grep --color=auto --exclude-dir=.bzr --exclude-dir=CVS --exclude-dir=.git --exclude-dir=.hg --exclude-dir=.svn 57102
```

my jsconfig:
```json
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "jsx": "react",
        "target": "es6",
        "module": "commonjs",
        "baseUrl": "./react/",
        "experimentalDecorators": true
    },  
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules",
        "static",
        "static1"
    ]
}
```

When I set  ``` typescript.disableAutomaticTypeAcquisition": true ```cpu is ok , but the node intellisense is not working.

data.title: Newer versions of npm not compatible with VS Code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Any commit hash between May and June 13th.
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.5
- Node: 8.1.1
- npm: 5.0.3 & 3.10.8

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Node fresh at version `8.1.1` (either through `nvm` or on a new machine. Both fail for me)
2. Verify that `npm` was installed at version `5.0.3`
3. As per the VS Code build instructions, run `./scripts/npm.sh install`
4. The install should fail
5. As found in the Windows instructions, install `npm` at version `3.10.8` via the following command:
  `npm install -g npm@3.10.8`
6. Re-run `./scripts/npm.sh install` successfully

Recommended course of action: 
1. lock the version of `npm` down in the README.md. 
2. Add explicit instructions to install and use `nvm`.

Alternatively do both 1&2 above, and additionally increase the required version of `npm` to something higher than `3.10.8` as well as raise the version of `lockfile` and any other necessary dependencies.

(I personally recommend the minimal route of enforcing an `npm` version)

I'll probably make a PR for this myself, but I wanted to log the issue for discussion first

data.title: Cannot copy terminal selection when select all is active
data.body: Select all doesn't set the context key apparently. Affects Linux, maybe Windows.
